library.description:
AngularJS lets you write client-side web applications as if you had a smarter browser. It lets use good old HTML (or HAML, Jade and friends!) as your template language and lets you extend HTML’s syntax to express your application’s components clearly and succinctly.

It automatically synchronizes data from your UI (view) with your JavaScript objects (model) through 2-way data binding. To help you structure your application better and make it easy to test AngularJS teaches the browser how to do dependency injection and inversion of control.

Oh yeah and it also helps with server-side communication, taming async callbacks with promises and deferreds; and make client-side navigation and deeplinking with hashbang urls or HTML5 pushState a piece of cake.
library.name: AngularJs

library.description:
Developers these days are spoiled with choice when it comes to selecting an MV* framework for structuring and organizing their JavaScript web apps.

Backbone, Ember, AngularJS, Spine... the list of new and stable solutions continues to grow, but just how do you decide on which to use in a sea of so many options?

To help solve this problem, we created TodoMVC - a project which offers the same Todo application implemented using MV* concepts in most of the popular JavaScript MV* frameworks of today.
library.name: TodoMVC

library.description: Backbone.js gives structure to web applications by providing models with key-value binding and custom events, collections with a rich API of enumerable functions, views with declarative event handling, and connects it all to your existing API over a RESTful JSON interface.
library.name: Backbone.js

library.description: Ember.js (formerly SproutCore 2.0) is a JavaScript framework that does all of the heavy lifting that you'd normally have to do by hand. There are tasks that are common to every web app; Ember.js does those things for you, so you can focus on building killer features and UI.
library.name: Ember.js

library.description: Knockout is a JavaScript MVVM (a modern variant of MVC) library that makes it easier to create rich, desktop-like user interfaces with JavaScript and HTML. It uses observers to make your UI automatically stay in sync with an underlying data model, along with a powerful and extensible set of declarative bindings to enable productive development.
library.name: Knockout

library.description: A composite application framework and infrastructure for Backbone. Make your Backbone applications dance!
library.name: MarionetteJS

library.description: Chaplin is an architecture for JavaScript applications using the Backbone.js library. The code is derived from moviepilot.com, a large single-page application.
library.name: Chaplin

library.description: Cappuccino is a web application framework providing you with everything you need to create desktop flavored applications running right on the browser of your users. Unlike most of JavaScript framework, Cappuccino completely abstract the DOM. Cappuccino relies on Objective-J, which is a superset of JavaScript and brings it real object-oriented programming.
library.name: Cappuccino

library.description: SproutCore is an open-source framework for building blazingly fast, innovative user experiences on the web. SproutCore applications move business logic to the browser so they can respond to your users' taps and clicks immediately, avoiding an agonizing roundtrip across often intermittent network connections.
library.name: SproutCore

library.description: JavaScript framework that makes building rich web applications easy. It strikes a balance between ease of use, safety, speed, flexibility.
library.name: CanJS

library.description: A simple, structured MVC web framework for NodeJS.
library.name: Geddy

library.description: Batman.js is a framework for building rich web applications with CoffeeScript or JavaScript. App code is concise and declarative, thanks to a powerful system of view bindings and observable properties. The API is designed with developer and designer happiness as its first priority.
library.name: Batman.js

library.description: Mojito is the JavaScript library implementing Cocktails, a JavaScript-based on-line/off-line, multi-device, hosted application platform.
library.name: Mojito

library.description:
Full Stack Web Framework for Node.js and the Browser.


Built on top of Node's Connect and Express, modeled after Ruby on Rails. Built for the client and server from the ground up.
library.name: Tower.js

library.description: MVC framework for NodeJS. It allows you to build web application in minutes. Works on client-side too.
library.name: CompoundJS

library.description:
The 1kb client side MVP framework.

The fastest, smallest and most powerful way to build large scale web applications.
library.name: Riot.js

library.description: Next-generation DOM manipulation.
library.name: Ractive.js

library.description: Bind models to views in Backbone style. Stickit offers a simple javascript configuration approach to model binding and seamlessly integrates into a Backbone project.
library.name: Stickit

library.description: Rivets.js is a declarative data binding facility that plays well with existing frameworks such as Backbone.js, Spine.js and Stapes.js. It aims to be lightweight (2.3KB minified and gzipped), extensible, and configurable to work with any event-driven model.
library.name: Rivets.js

library.description: Durandal is small JavaScript framework designed to make building Single Page Applications (SPAs) simple and elegant. We didn't try to re-invent the wheel. Durandal is built on libs you know and love like jQuery, Knockout and RequireJS. There's little to learn and building apps feels comfortable and familiar.
library.name: Durandal

library.description: brings Knockout.js magic to Backbone.js
library.name: Knockback.js

library.description: Agility is an MVC library for client-side Javascript that lets you write maintainable code without compromising on development speed. It's write less, do more with maintainability.
library.name: Agility.js

library.description: Locomotive is a web framework for Node.js. Locomotive supports MVC patterns, RESTful routes, and convention over configuration, while integrating seamlessly with any database and template engine. Locomotive builds on Express, preserving the power and simplicity you've come to expect from Node.
library.name: Locomotive.js

library.description:
Serenade.js is yet another MVC client side JavaScript framework. Why do we indulge in recreating the wheel? We believe that Serenade.js more closely follows the ideas of classical MVC than competing frameworks and has a number of other advantages as well:

Clean, simple and logic less template language
Data bindings keep your views up-to-date without any extra work
Powerful caching features
Absolutely no dependencies, everything works without jQuery
No need to inherit from base classes anywhere (though you can if you want)
library.name: Serenade.js

library.description: A (really) tiny Javascript MVC microframework.
library.name: Stapes.js

library.description: eyeballs.js is a slim javascript library designed to sit on top of a javascript framework, such as jQuery or Prototype.
library.name: eyeballs.js

library.description: Epoxy is an elegant and extensible data binding library for Backbone.js; it provides feature-rich extensions of Backbone's Model and View components designed to hook view elements directly to data models. Epoxy captures some great aspects of Knockout.js and Ember.js in a familiar API that feels tastefully like Backbone, with minimal additional file size (8k min, 3k gzip). Some key features in Epoxy include:
library.name: Epoxy.js

library.description: I introduce myself, I'm Monocle and I'll help you to create amazing Apps with CoffeeScript.
library.name: Monocle

library.description:
pager.js is a JavaScript library based on KnockoutJS and jQuery that provides the possibility of creating single page applications in a declarative fashion - nesting subpages inside subpages where each subpage can be developed standalone but still communicate between each other.

This makes it easier to design very large scale single page web sites.
library.name: pagerjs

library.description: PlastronJS is an MVC written on top of the Closure Library made to work with the Advanced Optimizations of the Closure Compiler meaning less code down the wire. It has models, collections, and uses controls to make two way binding and listing of models easy
library.name: PlastronJS

library.description: Provides the M in MVC, while you tie the rest. While there are plenty of MVC frameworks available for JavaScript, most of them dictate a variety of other application design choices on you. Laces.js by contrast provides you with a Model, but nothing more. It provides you with the laces to tie your model to whatever View or Controller you prefer. It consists of about 600 lines of JavaScript code, including whitespace and comments.
library.name: Laces.js

library.description:
Choco

A delicious Javascript web framework made in Belgium!

Choco brings the MVC to the client side!

You like Javascript and you want to develop rich internet applications? You also know that HTML & CSS are powerful? Cappuccino & Sproutcore don’t feel like web development anymore?

Thanks to Choco, you’ll be able to easily develop maintainable web applications. A Choco app consists of only one HTML page, all the interactions are managed by Javascript. Your UI only uses HTML and CSS!
library.name: Choco

library.description: Mozart isn't a library that just handles rendering, a microframework that needs other libraries to boot, or a set of coupled tools. Mozart is an all-singing, all-dancing platform designed with one purpose in mind: To help you develop fast, rich and beautiful applications in minutes, not after you've got tens of disparate components to play nice together. Having said that, Mozart is modular - its default configuration contains all you will need to get going immediately, but if you want to integrate your favourite tool or framework you'll find it as friendly as it is complete.
library.name: Mozart

library.description: ColtJS is a simple framework allowing for easy deployment of JavaScript Applications using Asynchronous Module Definition (AMD). It's only dependency is RequireJS. The central concept behind behind Colt is simplicity. The framework is built to be lightweight, flexible, and highly efficient.
library.name: ColtJS

library.description: ComponentJS is a stand-alone MPL-licensed Open Source library for JavaScript, providing a powerful run-time Component System for hierarchically structuring the User-Interface (UI) dialogs of complex HTML5-based Rich Clients (aka Single-Page-Apps) — under maximum applied Separation of Concerns (SoC) architecture principle, through optional Model, View and Controller component roles, with sophisticated hierarchical Event, Service, Hook, Model, Socket and Property mechanisms, and fully independent and agnostic of the particular UI widget toolkit.
library.name: ComponentJS

library.description: Few tested opinions on how to handle deeply nested views in Backbone.js focusing on encapsulation and reusability.
library.name: Backbone.ViewMaster

library.description:
Gaffa attempts to speed up the development of complicated UI's by providing a rich binding layer between abitrary data and your UI.

Writing UI's using gaffa is unlike most other MVC/MVVM/etc frameworks for a number of different reasons.
library.name: gaffa.js

library.description: A simple javaScript library for creating the Model aspect of a MVC application.
library.name: modeljs

library.description:
MNML is an minimalist MVC framework built in JavaScript yo develop web applications easier and faster.

The main idea is to have the necessary tools to build our application.

Features:
- Router
- Databinding
- Templates
- Controllers
library.name: MNML.js - Minimalistic MVC framework

library.description: Ratchet is a light-weight JavaScript MVC framework that helps you build HTML5/JavaScript based applications.
library.name: Ratchet

library.description: HyperApp is a 1kb JavaScript library for building frontend applications.
library.name: hyperapp

library.description:
LiquidLava is a framework for building user interfaces, which scale from simple interactive elements on page to complex feature-rich applications. What makes it unique is transparent internal design: this means, that you always know, what you are doing, and what happens inside the framework.

Features include:


fast and powerful class system
powerful data-bound templates with inheritance support
framework is designed for customization: all widgets and even core can be customized with minimum effort
best practices: no dependency injection, no internal or private code - this makes it very simple and easy to learn
modular, decoupled and nonconflicting: parts of the framework can be used by themselves


Lava framework provides you with tools for solving your real-world tasks.
library.name: LiquidLava

library.description:
JavaScriptMVC is an open-source framework containing the best ideas in jQuery development.

It guides you to successfully completed projects by promoting best practices, maintainability, and convention over configuration.
library.name: JavaScriptMVC

library.description:
Jamal is a set of conventions and small javascript libraries to archieve a complete separation of html, css and javascript in your web application. Jamal is built on jQuery and inspired by MVC frameworks like Ruby on Rails, CakePHP and its derivatives.

So Jamal tries not to stand in your way and helps you to organize your javascript code. Javascript code is likely held in functions and used to end up in spaghetti.
library.name: Jamal

library.description: Ivy ties JavaScript objects to the DOM, allowing you to focus on the relationships of your data.  You get an MVVM (model view / view model) implementation, and live templating.  It does this with no external dependencies, and with a small footprint (9k minified).
library.name: Ivy.js

library.description: PhotonJS is an extensible JavaScript MVC library supporting declarative bindings. It uses less resources than other, similar frameworks.
library.name: PhotonJS

library.description:
NgxAni is an animation plugin for AngularJS2+.

It is very simple and convenient to use. At the same time it has very good compatibility.

NgxAni is a service class, do not rely on any file. You can use it in any Component or Directive.
library.name: NgxAni

library.description: Mithril is a client-side MVC framework - a tool to organize code in a way that is easy to think about and to maintain
library.name: Mithril

library.description: WebRx is a Javascript MVVM-Framework built on ReactiveX for Javascript (RxJs) that combines functional-reactive programming with Observable-driven declarative Data-Binding, Templating and Client-Side Routing.
library.name: Webrxjs

library.description: Cycle.js is a reactive and functional web application framework, where the user is a function, the computer is a function, and Human-Computer Interaction is a fixed point equation over reactive event streams.
library.name: Cycle

library.description: Rx functional interface to Facebook's React
library.name: Cycle React
